jobDescription: What you will be doing! The Senior Data Scientist will be developing highly complex programmatic and quantitative methods to find patterns and relationships in large data sets; utilizing complex mathematical, statistical or other data-driven problem solving analysis to identify significant intelligence issues or trends in business operations to senior internal and external customers. They are expected to work independently under broad guidance from the government client.  Duties and Responsibilities: Under government direction, lead a subset of the data science program through the identification of strategic methodological issues and areas of focus to support decision-making by the most senior policymakers.  Mentor the full range of data scientists to support employee and product development  Compile data to address the most complex intelligence issues or problems for senior internal/external customers  Provide accurate, timely, highly complex and sophisticated data analysis in support of key agency, U.S. national security, and foreign policy objectives, Agency business operations, and to shape Intelligence Community (IC) analysis and priorities.  Conceive, prepare, and communicate a wide range of strategic, highly complex graphics, computational models/tools, or written/oral assessments to internal and external peers and customers (e.g., policymakers, IC components).  Manage projects and associated resources Knowledge, Skills, Abilities: Extensive knowledge of individual, organizational, technological, or transnational issues of national security concern  Extensive knowledge appropriate analytic methods and methodological tools in one or more of the following areas:  Applied mathematics (e.g. probability and statistics, formal modeling, computational social sciences)  Computer programming (e.g. programming languages, math/statistics packages, computer science, machine learning, scientific computing)  Visualization (e.g. GIS/geospatial analysis, telemetry analysis)  Extensive knowledge of research designs  Thorough knowledge of project management concepts and principles  Intellectual curiosity; creativity and innovation to go beyond current tools to deliver the best solutions to complex problems.  Exceptional analytical and critical thinking skills  Ability to leverage multiple data management tools to organize relevant information and make decisions  Ability to develop comprehensive software applications, as needed  Ability to translate complex, technical findings into an easily understood narrative in graphical, verbal, or written form  Ability to effectively express complex, multi-disciplinary ideas and insights  Ability to identify and/or develop business opportunities  Ability to multitask and change focus quickly as demands change Technologies to know: Statistical Tools may include: SAS, R, SPSS, Matlab, Mahout/MADlib, Stata  Programming languages: SQL, C/C++, JAVA, Python, Perl  Data Management Tools my include: Hadoop tools, MapReduce, Pig, Hive, NoSql, Tableau, Hbase Qualifications: Approx 15 years of related experience  M.S or PhD degree in quantitative or technical field of study (e.g., statistics, mathematics, computer science, physical science, quantitative social sciences).
